alert.note: Alert for Marion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 4:29PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MARION COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whitwell to near Monteagle. These storms were moving southeast around 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jasper, South Pittsburg, Whitwell, Kimball, Monteagle, Powells Crossroads, Orme, Martin Springs, Fiery Gizzard State Park, and Griffith Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
